channel.title: [Flash] Loading externals
channel.description: Right I will go straight to the point I have been having some problems with loading my externals in a real time fashion now this can be in any form and I don't mind if it's only updated every second or so but I am finding it very difficult and when I try to loop it just crashes the flash.

item.title: [Flash] Loading externals
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

so the file its grabbing is being edited constantly? if its not then there is no need to re grab the file everys econd because my way will load it and then you can do what you want with it. Regardless of how you do it the manner above is the way to bring the file into the document, unless you have changed the way in which you are grabbing (which is pointless seeing as how this works fine)

Read full topic

item.title: [Flash] Loading externals
item.dc:creator: @tythus tythus
item.description:
@tythus wrote:

Wasn’t what I was looking for but I was looking for that but for it to consistently update (so every 1 second it would look up new data without any user interaction) I guessed at it and it worked so it’s all good just made s movie clip of it and had it loop back to the start of it every second to reload it and it works

Read full topic

item.title: [Flash] Loading externals
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

aah thats simple, i had to learn how to do it when i made a music player. Basically it works like this:
firstly you wana to declare whatever it is so in my case it was:

playlist = new XML();

then i loaded the XML file at the end by doing:

playlist.load("prodigy.xml");

thats just the reading of the file mind you the rest will be up to you

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tythus tythus
item.description:
@tythus wrote:

such as an external text/php/xml file as currently to reload it the user hasto do something and that’s not what I want so I was wondering if there is any other way?
